website_summaries.verdict: One of the best general computer tower cases you can use for gaming or daily office tasks and intensive graphics.
pros: The interior of the tower offers plenty of space for different sizes of cooling fans to create the best arrangement of air flow
3 color-changing fans come pre-installed in the front for central cooling
cons: Proper air flow inside the case is harder to achieve due to difficult-to-follow instructions

website_summaries.verdict: RGB fans really add to both the aesthetic and air flow here, although issues with the fans and case may put off some buyers.
pros: Comes in several sizes and colors
Pre-installed with three 120-millimeter RGB fans in the front, with support for an additional 120-millimeter rear fan and a 360-millimeter front radiator
cons: RGB fans do not come with a controller
add this to your build cost
No place to install a DVD/CD player

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Product came damaged. Chipped and bent in multiple spots. Paint is straight up peeling in one area. Box is fine though.
customer_reviews.author: evelyn

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Just got the case today and unboxed it. Much to my chagrin, the of the four included fan blades ere laying in the bottom of the case. I'll update once I move my build to the MB530P' ...So quality id trash...I've replaced the I\O panel, fans, cables, etc. Still broken. Worked for a few hours. Fans are half lit. garbage and a waste. On a side note, Cooler Master tried to fix by sending new parts, which they shouldn't have to/'
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: This thing gets too hot.
customer_reviews.text: This case is for low end gaming components that will not get as hot as newer end cpus and gpus. You can only run a 120mm fan liquid cooler so you cant have big wiener computer parts or else they will overheat in this case 100%. I do not recommend if you have big wiener hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Vykruta

customer_reviews.title: Missing Fan
customer_reviews.text: Case seems decent, though I'm upset that my order came without the rear fan. I'm building a PC for the first time and I have the mobo, cooler, and memory installed. I just realized that I don't have the rear fan and my options are to keep this case and buy a 120mm fan or to return it and find another case (since this once is listed as out of stock). Would have given four stars for the missing piece but downgraded to three since the area at the bottom of the case for the power supply is closed off and complicates the wiring.
customer_reviews.author: Jared M. Pace

customer_reviews.title: Not built yet
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this case. I've never been a fan of overly complicating things for the sake of complication. This is sleek and simple and yet very functional. If you are one to like overly complicated things, this case is great for that too, because there's a large glass panel to show off your very fancy nightlights. Just teasing. Really the only problem I could see with this case is somebody not having enough room for it. It is quite large, but it's great for my needs. It would have been nice if the paper instructions were more detailed though.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, horrible thermals, awkward build.
customer_reviews.text: This case looks exactly with the pictures and is a great deal for tempered glass with all of the fans included. That being said it has horrible thermals, even with all of the fans. With the glass panel off I could reduce my CPU temp by 10 degrees. The build was also pretty inconvenient. Because it has glass on both sides you have to hide your wires behind a secondary panel that is slightly too tight and needs to be unscrewed for any adjustment. There is also no ssd slot in the drive bay.
customer_reviews.author: Jory Leech

customer_reviews.title: Great mATX!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say...the best 60 bucks you'll ever spend on an mATX case. This design has great airflow, space and aesthetics and they give you 2 argb 120 mm fans on top of it. You have room for 240 rad up top and up front at the same time. It can even hold 140 fans. Cable management is basic. Nothing really exiting there but that's not neccesarily a bad thing either. Great job Cooler Master!
customer_reviews.author: Freddy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing build quality
customer_reviews.text: I have to knock it a star for a couple of reasons. 1. Not enough USB ports, only 2 instead of 4... 2. Screws supplied are not magnetic which makes it a huge pain to screw in MoBo 3. No top vents for a dual fan cooler NOW. This case has amazing build quality, nice glass, nice fans. runs cool as ice. Buttons are very solid and the screws to get inside of the case is very easy to take off. For the price, I can't see any other case beating it. Perfect for single fan water cooling. The Corsair Hydro 80i v2 fits perfectly inside.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Wetta

customer_reviews.title: looks pretty good
customer_reviews.text: looks good but has some clear cheap out features like the pop off io covers for the graphics card on the back and the rear fan grill was warped in a bit but luckily putting a fan on solved that issue. was well worth the $60 i spent on it and either way havent noticed much difference in cooling over my last case. rgb fans look cooler than alot ive seen with how they look like a hypno swirl on solid color mode. like the removable hdd cage so when i get rid of hdd storage i dont have to have it there taking up space and dont have to dremel it out. would recommend
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: Design fault, poor airflow
customer_reviews.text: Front panel doesn't allow enough airflow , especially if you use a 360 rad like it's designed for. I'm running Corsair ML fans in push pull also. You have to run it with the front panel off which makes it look awful . Coolermaster customer service is laughable , will never ever buy another CM product after this disaster of a product.
customer_reviews.author: Dave H

customer_reviews.title: Sent back needed an RGB not ARGB
customer_reviews.text: Make sure to read the description. This isn't compatible with ARGB motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Lethargic Usagi

customer_reviews.title: Great case, front plastic cover could use some holes for ventilation...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great case and the only reason for 4 stars is the front of the case. The plastic cover is solid and there isn't much air flow for the 3 fans behind it. Of course, the plastic cover could be pulled off but then you have spinning fans exposed. Simple fix, take a small hole-saw and drill a grid pattern in the plastic and put it back on. Voila, problem solved. PC stays cool and case is extremely roomy and functional. For the price, this is an amazing case!
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this case!!!
customer_reviews.text: I do really love this case, the construction is good, setup and building my rig wasnt bad at all. One thing to know, if you want the led lighted fans to light up, best thing to get is the cool master rgb led light controller. It's only around 35 bucks and you can fully control the light colors. I couldn't figure out how to make them light up without it. They would spin but not light. The clear dark glass let's you see your masterpiece so light up memory, light up video card, and even lighted power supply fan is a must!
customer_reviews.author: John Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Great Case
customer_reviews.text: This case is really awesome! The layout is really nice, and I like that it comes with fans already and that they are RGB. After plugging everything in and setting everything up it works perfectly. The only minor gripe I have is that the case doesn't have amazing air flow, so when I'm playing really demanding games I normally just take off the front panel, which is really easy. I just do it for peace of mind, I'm sure it would be fine but I would rather not burn out my Ryzen or GTX 1080.
customer_reviews.author: eli brown

customer_reviews.title: Great case! Just one small issue
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome case for the price. I had almost little to no issues with this case while assembling my pc. However, the only issue I had was that the connectors for the fans for the front of the case were too short. They do include a molex connector to solve this, but if your motherboard doesn’t include a molex connection then the fan cables will not reach the connection on the motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing case, need to add extra fans if you're building a good gaming computer
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing, looks absolutely stunning Great air flow Actually the air flow is so good that I'm freezing everytime I play it I suggest not putting it in a small room in the middle of fall Might lose a toe or something But I do suggest adding more fans if you are building a good gaming computer (Might be a small part of the freezing the toes off problem) I saw some reviews saying that the power supply doesn't fit, but they are all a pretty standard size and mine fit nicely I can see the problem as the cords are hard to maneuver, but not impossible Overall an excellent case with great airflow
customer_reviews.author: T.Griffey

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this case to my friends
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's a beautiful looking and quite affordable case with plenty of options for mounting SSD's and such. I pulled out all my 3.5" mounting hardware for maximum, unimpeded airflow. My temps all well within acceptable norms even under load. The cable management options are more than most, however it's really up to you how you cram the cables into the opposite side of the case which is not huge. I managed it fine however, getting away with a pretty clean looking installation.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Kerber

customer_reviews.title: Stock fans and case
customer_reviews.text: Since many people ask about the stock fans. Here is my review about them. They are cheaper versions of the masterfan mf120 argb. The blades are a frosted white semi clear compared to the mf120 argb which is fully clear. The picture I linked shows the 2 stock fans top and bottom with a mf120 argb in the middle. They dont sell the stock fans probably because it's a knock off fan. Rpms is like 1250 on these where the mf120 argb hits 2000 rpm.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan d.

customer_reviews.title: Great Mid Tower CoolerMaster !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Case plenty of Room for future upgrading First Ryzen 5 3600 built, dont come with extra top Fans but does have front fans but was very impressed with airflow for the price it is nice has mesh front vent and bottom front mesh intake as well like the dark tinted design on glass and easy to remove and room for install everything the XFX RX 5700 XT Thicc Ultra III fit great and looks cool !!! Great Job CoolerMaster !!! Just ordered a 2nd Tower For wife for Same built 8>} She loves it
customer_reviews.author: Eric C Russell

customer_reviews.title: Power switch pins weren't attached
customer_reviews.text: Good case, easy to mount, everything accessible. I spent hours trying to get my mobo to run, but would not power on, so I shorted the power switch jumper with a screw driver, bingo, started. Then I looked around, the power switch wires were not even attached to the case... I guess I just got the shaft, but hey, I can try and fix this and if I can't, I'll dremel out a switch from another computer. Good case, just they should do some better quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing, beautiful case!
customer_reviews.text: Mere words cannot describe how great this case is. It looks sharp, the side panel is ONE BIG PIECE OF GLASS! It's beautiful. Word of warning though, if you have more than 2 HDDs, there is little room. This world be great if you have a board with an NVME (which I world recommend anyway). If you have a liquid cooled system, THIS IS THE CASE YOU WANT! Very pleased. Might actually move my main PC into this one...
customer_reviews.author: Xolin_

customer_reviews.title: Great case great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great tower Pros. * glass side is sleek * the 4 fans are quite *RGB on fans have tons of customization * a ridiculous amount of space to build in * strudy all around Cons *Front plastic plate covering fans dont stay on to well My build fits this case with flying colors B450 tomahawk with cooler CPU Corsair 850w PSU geforce 1660ti GPU Kingston 240gb ssd 2 Viper 8gb ram 1tb hhd All fit amazing
customer_reviews.author: Jacob dipaula

customer_reviews.title: Case Modifications Temps
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this case about seven months ago and I reviewed all the complaints about cooling and was a bit concerned myself but with a few small case modifications I was able to minimize this problem. First I will say that cutting a fans hole at the top of this case was quite a challenge because the case is definitely made of a very durable material, but I managed to do so. Adding that 80 mm fan at the top lowed the temps inside the case. I also drilled several holes through the front glass to create extra ventilation points. The case has really good cable management space. The price was right and could use it if modifications are made.
customer_reviews.author: Wilbert Brown

customer_reviews.title: Button selector can be used even if the board doesn't support the connector.
customer_reviews.text: My son can't stop telling me how cool his case is... It is getting old but it is pretty damn cool. His board didn't support the color control but you can manually control it with a button. He likes the pulsing/breathing green. On the install side it only comes with those front fans so you will need a few more for the back and top. The installation was great and there is a ton of room. The case material is a bit thin (I can bend parts of it with my hands, however no complaints for the cost. Excellent case with nice lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie

customer_reviews.title: a beautiful case but
customer_reviews.text: this was one of my favorite cases they put good thought into its design except for one big flaw. AIRFLOW, the three fans in front are awesome but the cover lacks big time in ventilation. they later fixed this issue with the new MB539P which I now own. cooler master makes some of the best cases at some of the best prices and they listen to the people. I highly recommend the newish MB539P
customer_reviews.author: drykill_23

customer_reviews.title: Echoing other reviews
customer_reviews.text: The RGB Pro 5 comes with the four fans pre-installed, which is nice, but has only one exhaust fan and no way to add more so any aftermarket coolers will be limited by how quickly the one exhaust fan can get rid of the hot air. Current setup is a Ryzen 5 3600x and a GTX 2060. System idles at about 34C, under max load it sits around 69C. I'm happy with it for now, but I might end up modding it so I can put a second exhaust fan on top.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: 2 included fans not working
customer_reviews.text: 2 ARGB included fans not working. The fans are spinning but there are no lights, I tried multiple headers and nothing, pretty disappointed, at least they are still able to cool my components. Other than that the case is perfect, plenty of room for cable management. Power supply shroud able to hold many unused cables. Wish the expansion slots were able to be screwed off rather than just bending them out, plus make sure you pull them out before you put the motherboard in or you won’t be able to bend it the right way, learned that the hard way.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Bass

customer_reviews.title: Better off with other cases for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not a huge fan, but not a bad grab for $70. PS shroud doesn’t cover the whole bottom, making cable management be visible even to amateurs, and I did hate the positioning of the HHDs. Also, no filter on the front glass for the fans, so I had to clean it three times in a month, and we clean our house weekly (maybe why the constant dust? Idk). Last picture is to contrast the fans with the lights, as you can see they are very dim and monotone. Doesn’t come with rgb/fan controller, and doesn’t sync lights that are not Cooler Master.
customer_reviews.author: Raf C

customer_reviews.title: Snatch
customer_reviews.text: Best looking case I've ever had. Its also very durable and very useful features. You can really show off your rig nicely. Ihave a huge l shape desk and it sits on top Only thing for me is the rbg cables for the fans don't workfor my motherboard. The fand are the 3 pin and motherboard is 4 :( So i gotta find something work
customer_reviews.author: chris crow

customer_reviews.title: This case is Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This case is simple a great awesome case, i love it with my ryzen 7 3800x with two exhaust fans to the top no overheating problems, and interested in buy another one to have for an upgrade next year maybe a ryzen 3950x...great case
customer_reviews.author: Winston Guerra

customer_reviews.title: No Regrets
customer_reviews.text: A great case that comes with everyone you need inside without breaking the bank. Pros: Tempered glass side panel (only one side) and see through plastic (not sure what kind) on the front, comes with RGB fans, notable ground clearance, plenty of space for additional SSDs/liquid cooling reservoirs/pumps, HDD space, is relatively cheap, and it looks clean. Cons: Doesn't come with additional SSD brackets (only two 2.5" brackets, so you will have to buy more or use M.2), no space for fans on top, right side panel is just metal, not tempered glass like the left
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: BEST CASE IVE BUILT IN
customer_reviews.text: This case is so good looking, with good airflow and a nice small size. Fits everything perfectly, such amazing cable management with a lot of space for it making it so easy. The RGB can be controlled by the reset switch and connects to my Thermaltake UX100 CPU cooler (so nice for cheap RGB PCs to sell. The case feels very nice. It's made of good quality metals and the glass is perfect and so nice looking. Don't bother buying a cheap case and putting RGB fans in it, this is much better value.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Grogan

customer_reviews.title: 10 out of 10
customer_reviews.text: Okay so I am good with tech terms and won'tbe using too many of them. This was my first pc build and I am in love. Please read the included instructions while you install the component. Thencase looks amazing and comes with 2 120mm rbg fan that connects to the motherboard. There is no need to purchased any hardware like motherboard or GPU screws all are included. Just to add, if you install a GPU I would recommend getting another 3 fans to help with cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Lennon

customer_reviews.title: Easiest build ever
customer_reviews.text: I have built a few computers since the end of the 1990s, last one 7 years ago, and none has been as easy as this one. The case is clean, easy to setup, silent, and looks amazing with the AMD LED cooler in it, although I haven't yet got the LEDs in the fans to turn on (will need to read the manual for that, I guess). Really happy I got this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer from Redmond, WA

customer_reviews.title: Great case!
customer_reviews.text: Considering the Case shortage and trying to find any case that has at least an MATX size and great air flow Potentual. Cooler Master hit this one out of the park.. It was at a decent price also. It was so good I bought a second case before they went out of stock.... RGB fans and a nice look its well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gatomon

customer_reviews.title: I’m happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Really a great case for the money. I don’t believe it came in white but that was a choice my daughter made after the purchase but wasn’t a big deal. Plenty of room for add ons. I added a 240mm radiator and two 120mm fans up top which was easy to do. Since I was going to be overclocking I’m sure the case would get a little warm with only one exhaust fan. That would maybe be the only downside to this case in my opinion. Other than that I’m very happy with my budget build for my daughters first pc.
customer_reviews.author: Chad gustafson

customer_reviews.title: Great airflow. Great looks. Easy to build in
customer_reviews.text: Good amount of space. Make sure to read how to install SSD drive prior to installing motherboard. Included fans are just ok. They produce good airflow. They also make noises occasionally. I’m a stickler for fan noise so I might be to picky. Either way I would buy and use this case again. Air flow throughout case is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: FpsMafia

customer_reviews.title: Nice Case.
customer_reviews.text: Nice study case with plenty of room inside. Just wish the case had four USB slots on the front vs the two. The clips for the Hard-Drive...please go back to the screws! That piece of junk.....anyway after couple hours of fiddling with the stupid thing...reckon we got it. It's in place and the computer is working...we'll leave it at that.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Love this case, my rig looks awesone
customer_reviews.text: The case came in a few days, I moved my rig from one base unit to this one in a couple of hours, everything fitted perfectly. The tinted glass side looks awesome, I am over the moon with it, not sure why the rear fan wasn't LED but I can replace that easily, also not sure why the power pack cover does not go all the way across the bottom hiding all of the wires. Other than that no complaints at all. 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Dean waters

customer_reviews.title: quiet fans, plenty of room, easy cable management
customer_reviews.text: notably, the case comes with 4 fans. they are very quiet. 3 in the front are RGB (but not ARGB) and the exhaust fan in the back has no LED. lots of well placed holes for cable management. plenty of space behind the back panel to zip tie everything together. space for 2x 2.5" drives and 2x 3.5" drives.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Spak

customer_reviews.title: Not the cream de la crop, but not a horrible garbage fire either
customer_reviews.text: The layout of this tower is very nice, and the transparent tinted glass allows you to show off what you have built. The arrangement of the fans isn’t ideal, and the amount of space available for ventilation leaves a bit to be desired. This case is fine if you decide to go the route of liquid cooling for your cpu. If not, and your perhaps planning on using an air cooling system for your entire tower. Then I wouldn’t recommend this tower. That being said a tower, and 4 120mm fans for 80 bucks isn’t a terrible deal. So buy wisely
customer_reviews.author: LeviCLund

customer_reviews.title: solid case looks really nice
customer_reviews.text: really nice glas side panel, perfect for showing off the guts of your machine, no DVD drive slots just a sleek look. Its magnetic dust cover on the top was a cool addition. was a little difficult to place my power supply in to the base the bays being less than an inch away doesnt leave much space for the wires to go to the bord. update... mine didn't have a rear case fan as in the photos on the page case is kinda cramped when it comes to putting in the powersuply
customer_reviews.author: Darren Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great mATX case for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this case. Came with everything I need. My only gripe is that, if you're using an Asus ROG Strix Rx480 8gb, your GPU fans don't really get a chance to breathe, making the twin front fans an absolute must, if you don't wanna over heat your GPU.
customer_reviews.author: mimichi.xox

customer_reviews.title: You won't find a better looking case.
customer_reviews.text: This case as perfect as it gets. It looks awesome comes with two fans and has all the attachments you need(Even though it has two fans it connects via one connector ). The only downside and this is strictly just a visual issue is that you cannot change the colors of the fans I tried several different software but couldn't figure it out but still for the fact that this case is around 60 bucks is an incredible great job, Cooler Master.
customer_reviews.author: Ebram Mekhail

customer_reviews.title: Isn’t the greatest for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The case had a good amount of space to work with powers supplies. Hard drive rack can be moved around to add bigger fans or a water cooler. Came with an some extra pieces which is always helpful. But the case had really bad quality fans. They’re not mounted with traditional screws, rather they put in plastic pins. The cables for the fans weren’t long enough to work with standard motherboards. RGB connections couldn’t connect with my RGB header, ordered a new adapter for the fans. Front panel looks kinda cheap. Overall it’s an ok choice for someone starting out on building PCs. But there’s better.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful case, but missing screws
customer_reviews.text: The case is beautiful and sleek, and very spacious. However, I had a difficult time screwing in the 1070ti to the case itself. Not sure if it was just my case, but the space between the case and the video card made it so the car couldn't be screwed in. Also, our case did not come with any screws for mounting any of our hardware. We had to go out and buy screws just so we could install all our pieces. We looked everywhere in the box and inside the case, because some reviews said the screws come hidden very well, but ours were just entirely missing.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: My Best Build!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first CM master box. I got the MB-520 and it was wonderful to work with. Cooler Master thought about wire management when they designed this one. It was a breeze. By far my tidiest looking build, and tons of space. I also like the smoked tempered glass panel that retains the screws.
customer_reviews.author: azglenh

customer_reviews.title: The selling points for me were the free shipping and the included fans.
customer_reviews.text: The case works fine except for the RGB controller, which came with damaged pins. I don't have time to to undo everything I've put in the case already because it's for a gift computer that I'm building with my wife, so I will just have to buy another $5 RGB controller.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Had a little Uh Oh 🥺
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful case, it is significantly a better mesh front case than the Fractal Design Focus G. My fans don't suck dust all over the front filters, if it they do I can clean it. For the price, the quality feels like I paid $100+ for it. I love than fans, oh how much I do, I stare at the colors like a mosquito! But now it seems that my bottom fan has given out...after only 3 DAYS of use. It's not a big deal considering how cheap rgb fans are. But I'm very mad that I have to rewire and replace it 🙄 such a hassle
customer_reviews.author: Eugene E.

customer_reviews.title: Great case, RGB fans look great
customer_reviews.text: This case was easy to set up, and looks great in my opinion. The glass on the side panel is thick, slightly tinted, and appears to be high quality, unlike other cheap plastic sides I've seen in the past. Apparently this case has issues with airflow due to the way the front fans are covered, but I wouldn't worry about it unless you're doing serious overclocking. I haven't had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: swampthing

customer_reviews.title: Great Case with Great Airflow.....Case Slightly Bubbling
customer_reviews.text: Great case! Does everything I want, allows for proper air flow, and is really slick looking. Only thing I found odd is that the front panel started to bubble very slightly. Not sure why. And yes, the protective film is already peeled off. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Kevbo

customer_reviews.title: incorrect description
customer_reviews.text: The description for this case says the fans are ARGB, but the one I received has RGB fans. This means the LEDs on the fans cannot be individually controlled for lighting effects. It's a tight fit to get everything plugged in, not the easiest cable management, but I managed to make it work without too much difficulty.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great case for this price
customer_reviews.text: It was an overall great case for this price point. Case looks nice. Rgb fans are full of color and don’t look cheap. Great airflow. Only problem is very minor and not worth lowering the rating for and that’s that there is an opening at the basement of the case where you can see inside the basement and if you stuffed extra cables and such down there is not good. Since you can see it through the tempered glass. But most of you may not even have that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Alma Perez

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: So far great! but 1 thing I noticed is that the front fans don't spin when you put your pc to sleep mode, I have to touch the fans in order to spin it, but the RGB is good! I would recommend getting the MB311 if you want to have awesome air intake from front, the MB320L has plastic in front and side mesh
customer_reviews.author: Mahin Rashid

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful case, plenty of holes that I can hide ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful case, plenty of holes that I can hide cables with, plenty of airflow. Just need to get the RGB controller so the lights on it actually work, would've been nice if they included in it, seeing as the RGB variant of another case(Only thing different is the fans are RGB, but they do not include the RGB controller, so RGB Fans are essentially just regular fans for now)
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Eaton

customer_reviews.title: This is the second Cooler Master. You will not go wrong with this product!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this case. This is the second Cooler Master case and I love both of them. They showoff your work that you spent assembling your computer. A very nice dark 'glass" side panel is really cool. Cooler Master does a remarkable job designing and building their cases. The case is well made with nice heavy metal. The hard drives fit nicely where you don't see all the wires. I will never buy anything but Cooler Master!
customer_reviews.author: Gerald W. Malone

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Looking Case
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this a great looking case, but it is also very easy to build in. It makes cable management a breeze, I will add photos to this review soon and you will be able to see how clean I as a first time PC builder was able to make my build look with this case.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Great case. Easy install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to drop in parts. No optical drive bays, so you can fit really big GPUs in there. Feels like a full-tower in a mid-tower size. Update: Can confirm that it'll fit a 360 radiator for water cooling. Installed an Enermax LIQFUSION 360 yesterday.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, I like the size, the way it sits on my desk etc. Note: Your motherboard has to have an RGB header to for the RGB fans, otherwise you have to buy a controller. I didn't know that as this is my first pc build. I'm actually using the 2 2.5 inch drive spots, and 1 of the 3.5 inch. Really happy with those. Would buy again. Also, nothing shipped bent/warped, the glass showed up looking nice. I think one screw might have been a little cross threaded, but otherwise, super happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great case for starters but not for what I need it for :(
customer_reviews.text: It was a cool case but the case fans didn’t line up with the holes after opening side panel, the risers didn’t match my Micro atx board, and yes I did move them to the correct slot or thread position and I’d didn’t come with remote to change rgb fans witch is fine I can I have program do that for me, and frankly I don’t care about rgb hahaah but the case was light. But too light aluminum because you were supposed to Bend out the spacing for the the gpu slot and I was like no way it just didn’t fit my gpu was a 130 and i thought it said 140 mm length
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great case, needed fan extensions.
customer_reviews.text: This case looks great with everything assembled. Cable management is decent and the material is pretty good quality, seems sturdy. My only problem with building is that the case fans it comes with didnt have long enough cords to reach my motherboard (Asus Tuf gaming x570 plus wifi) so I had to order extensions. Other than that I dont have a definitive answer on thermals yet but they seem to be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota Strout

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Include fan
customer_reviews.text: This Case look great and offers great airflow. The easily removeable filter on the bottom and the top make cleaning super easy. The only think I did not like, is that in all the images a rear fan at the back of the case is shown, but did NOT come with it. Which made me need to spend extra on a fan in order to exhaust the air coming in from the front
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Looks absolutely gorgeous and plenty of space for parts and cable management
customer_reviews.text: Using a Coffee Lake i5 and an EVGA 1070. I love everything about this case: the RGB and the fans, the glass, the space for parts/cables. Easy clean too with some electronic safe compressed air. Cooler Master made a return customer when I build another down the line but that definitely won't be for a while. Maybe a little bit of a bigger case if you're going with top end i7 or i9 with 1080 or 2080 single or SLI but for my build it's absolutely perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great stylish case
customer_reviews.text: awesome case for the price I have had 2 master cooler cases back to back and I plan to make a third, they make an awesome cases they have put a lot of thought into the design of this case, it has a TON of airflow and I like the back panel wiring concealer.
customer_reviews.author: drykill_23

customer_reviews.title: Looks great - Good air flow!
customer_reviews.text: I guess they wouldn't be cooler master if they didn't keep your components cool. I was able to fit this baby with 4 extra 120mm fans for a total of 7 120mm fans not including those on my cpu cooler. For those opting to do air cooling instead of using an aio like myself this case is great. And it has plenty of room if you choose to go the liquid route.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Camarena

customer_reviews.title: Very nice affordable case. Recommended
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost it's very functional, great cable runs, good air flow quality materials, good build quality. The adjustable RGB lights are a nice touch, makes the guts look great, very nice hardware presentation! This case cost me 20 more than the cheapski case, and that's 20 well spent!!
customer_reviews.author: MattTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not the best or easiest for a large-radiator liquid cooled CPU
customer_reviews.text: Tempered glass on side is great. Wish the front was glass as well. Moved one RGB fan to replace the rear, it's a bit noisy. There's plenty of room in the case, no complaints there. If you use ASUS Aura (which I don't recommend), it's easy to control the setup of the RGB fans. I would give it a higher review if there was a top mount for the CPU radiator, that would really make this case worthwhile.
customer_reviews.author: Crage Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good quality case for its price
customer_reviews.text: I built a pc using this case, a gigabyte a320m motherboard, 1050ti and ryzen 5 2600 cpu. Everything worked out just fine. I haven't built a pc in years, so it took me half a day to finish it. One thing to note is that the 4 pin system fan header on the motherboard IS compatible with the rgb fans on the case. I pretty much fiddled around and stuck cables together not knowing what the hell I was doing, and the rgb fans actually worked along with the rgb controller. Overall I think I got my money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Lit up like a Christmas tree
customer_reviews.text: This case is a beast. It's huge. Installing motherboard and other components is easy. If you want your rig to look like a christmas tree with plenty of light this is a great case. Set up a system for my son. Only thing I would change is I would include the RGB controller with the case. I ended up buying one after the fact so he could play with the front fan lights more.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Oates

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR ADVANCED PC BUILDERS.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a terrible case, the spacing is quite horribly done there isn’t space to mount radiators which causes the coolers to place pressure on ram. It’s a cramped setup and installing a vertical gpu mount requires removing ssd caddy. Finally the fans in the front panel were defective, they light up but refuse to spin at all. Definitely the worst case I’ve ever used I wouldn’t recommend it, and to add insult to injury you need to purchase an rbg fan controller to affect the front panel fans.
customer_reviews.author: ali pacheco

customer_reviews.title: Must buy for a mid tower
customer_reviews.text: I think my only complaint would be the power supply cover to make it look pretty is not removable and it would be nice if it was for cleaning purposes and to make installation easier. I loved the a out of airflow the case provided and cooler master has showed by this case they have really brought up their standards over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Shrek&Donkey

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend you to buy it!
customer_reviews.text: The case have a great look, but there is a main problem, it doesn't really have a good airflow, because of that, i take the front pannel off, and my computer start getting some dust. (my room used to be satans room) i wouldn't recomend you to buy this case, it doesn't have a good airflow i'll recoment you to invest $50 more dollars for a better case!
customer_reviews.author: Rony Pascual

customer_reviews.title: Avoid CoolerMaster, no docs, no support
customer_reviews.text: Very dissatisfied with product, documentation and voice technical support. Product came with zero documentation. Online documents has zero information about cabling such as what cabling is included, the cable end types, the cable length etc. Chat support said to voice call for support. Voice call got recording saying to call back again anagin until you get a real person. Obviously CoolerMaster is not a choice if you ever snticipate having a question or a problem. Avoid Coolermaster like the Coronavirus!!!
customer_reviews.author: L. CARLTON

customer_reviews.title: Not enough air flow for an air cooled
customer_reviews.text: The first problem was the fans in front make buzzing noise. Then when I push my system in game. It was getting to hot. Notice the picture with the AMD logo on it see the cuts in the front grill and the 140 mm fans that fixed it now no fan noise and plenty of air flow for my air cooled rig. P.S. it is not easy to cut that cover.
customer_reviews.author: Philip C.

customer_reviews.title: Cute litetl box
customer_reviews.text: This box is smaller than in the picture but was able to fit my micro atx board without issues. It has a glass side cover that shows all the items inside. I added more fans to increase airflow. So far no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Cowwyhippoandbubu

customer_reviews.title: Well built, looks great and good price...highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome case. Well built, looks great and has decent airflow for mid to high performance builds. I added the Cooler Master RGB controller which integrated nicely making the RGB fans quite fun to watch.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Good design, but missing TWO mobo standoff hole/machining
customer_reviews.text: MB530p Lovely case overall but some of the areas with the holes for an ATX mobo were NOT machined or drilled properly and I could not screw in the “A” screws in place right in the lower left and middle left (looking at it in standing orientation from the side). The holes were smooth internally from front to back. Can’t say how this happened but im disappointed. Watch out for this issue. Edit: overall, while i think the case is phenomenal in design and potential, I don’t think it is good enough quality.
customer_reviews.author: Darkite

customer_reviews.title: If you are on a budget it works...
customer_reviews.text: For the price and what I got I won’t return it but the fans are LOUD, and there is 0 dust protectors on the intake fans ( a major problem especially with 3 cats). Also the front panel is plastic . So corners were cut to make it cheap
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kazel

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the no exhaust fans reviews
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and has good airflow. Also very spacious for a mid tower. As far as the no exhaust fan reviews, ignore them. There's no exhaust fan in the pictures. There's no exhaust fan in the description. That means it doesn't include and exhaust fan. It literally says it comes with 3 fans; the ones in the front.
customer_reviews.author: Donte'

customer_reviews.title: do not buy
customer_reviews.text: for the price you can get a better case, rear fan is noisy, both usb 3 in front are actually connected to one connector for the mother board and the lightning controller for whatever reason is inside the case, so you need to open it up in order to controll the light thru the controller, wish i could of return it right now!
customer_reviews.author: Michael David Pierce

customer_reviews.title: very nice case
customer_reviews.text: excellent case, lots of room when installing and for cable management. Area near powersupply is a bit tight but theres other options. Tempered glass window is solid and included case fans work and look great.
customer_reviews.author: Jason olsen

customer_reviews.title: Not that bad
customer_reviews.text: Reading the reviews were super mixed and confusing. some saying it came with 4 fans and some saying it did int come with a controller. Mine came perfectly in tact no damages. Did not come with an exhaust fan which i had to install my own (no problem might be for you). Mine did come with a controller which i found really neat. Overall well worth my money. Would give it a 5 star if the glass came with a peel (it didn't)
customer_reviews.author: Zytin

customer_reviews.title: Great case and for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: My friend suggested me getting this case after getting it himself and I was very pleased with it. It comes with 4 fans (one in the back and three in the front.) The three in the front are RGB which is always a nice feature. This case is also great at hiding cables and looks good all around for only under 100$. I would definitely recommend this to people looking for a mid tower.
customer_reviews.author: Tombomb

customer_reviews.title: Great design, a few downfalls
customer_reviews.text: overall decent quality, some of the paint chipped around the corner while installing hardware but otherwise the case itself is well built. Some downsides however, the rear case fan was installed backwards, all the fans on the case were forcing air into it with no outlet. In addition, the USB ports on the front of the case are very tight, almost to the point of things breaking off inside of them. The false back is useful for cable management, but the provided notches for tying things down are a tad shallow and can be somewhat difficult to attach to, especially near the edges. Overall, a good case in design.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Great airflow at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked with how easy it was to build in this case you can tell the designers understand what we need. Another pro is the mount of airflow you can get going in this case is very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: This case is great!
customer_reviews.text: This case is great! I was a little skeptical of it at first as I was looking to transfer the motherboard from a Lenovo ThinkCentre M91p Desktop into this case but the instructions were very straight forward and it was relatively easy to connect everything together. The fans can be a little noisy as it runs but for me that really isn’t a problem since i have a fan in my room that overpowers this noise. There’s even space at the top for a decent radiator. I do recommend this case for anyone on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous778

customer_reviews.title: Their customer service sucks
customer_reviews.text: The instructions for connection to power were mostly ambiguous pictures in a single paper sheet ‘manual’, and the suggested connection would not turn on the fans. Their customer service phone would not pick up and their WEB (email ticket platform) customer service responded by resending the same ambiguous manual... 20 days after I sent the service request! The only reason they don’t get 1 star is because after many trials I got the fans to work on my own (I didn’t use the manual’s recommendation).
customer_reviews.author: StainableCrib76

customer_reviews.title: Poorly assembled
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my first computer build for school. The bottom fan and light didn't work. Upon inspecting the connectors and wires I noticed that the wire for that fan was pinched in 2 places inside the front with the clips, which has cut the outer plastic and severed part of the wires. Since I need it for school I don't have the option to try to return it and get a replacement. So I guess I'm just stuck with a brand new defective product. The manufacturer should do a better job at quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Lena Herena

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: Case could have been packaged a bit better, more shape fit foam. Product arrived in great condition and is exactly what I wanted. I would recommend this case to others wanting to build their own system. The LED fans are super quiet and the set up for the controls is fairly simple.
customer_reviews.author: Paul & Stormy

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous
customer_reviews.text: This case is supremely beautiful. The window is lovely to look through and the fans in the front and be all sorts of different colors. I have mine cycling through the entire specturm. It's a high-airflow case, so there is some noise, but if you have really good, quiet fans, it's less of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Moffitt

customer_reviews.title: No rubber grommets??
customer_reviews.text: This case is great with plenty of room for options. Cable management is a breeze and easy to access. Plenty of air flow and I also installed the cooler master radiator up front. The ONLY reason I gave an overall 4 star rating is due to the fact the case did not come with rubber grommets.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Ernst

customer_reviews.title: Airflow
customer_reviews.text: Airflow is atrocious with the front panel on; to the point I’ve had to start gaming with it pulled off just to keep my CPU temps from going over 85°c. (Ryzen 5 2600x with stock clock speed and stock wraith cooler). And with the poor airflow comes the complete lack of filtering on the intake fans. The case looks good and QC seems to have worked well, but I can’t recommend this case for anyone who uses their rig for more than an hour or two at a time without some modifications.
customer_reviews.author: Simply_Suzzz

customer_reviews.title: Came defective was cheaper to sell to someone than to return it
customer_reviews.text: I give this a two star because I tried several power supplies and mother boards with this case and none of them could turn on with the power button but they work fine in my other cases I sold this case to someone on Craigslist for more than what I would have gotten back with return shipping being fairly expensive
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great airflow
customer_reviews.text: Wow.... my pc build is now complete and this case looks premium I had to buy few extra after market cpu coolers with RGB led but that’s it.. my pc definitely looks solid and great airflow..
customer_reviews.author: Sajja Satya Chandra Prasad

customer_reviews.title: Great case on a budget!!!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the case I had a bit of trouble with the fan extensions and all the rgb stuff. If my motherboard would’ve had argon support I could’ve done it easily but I only had JLED which is for lights only unfortunately. Nice case overall I wish it had grommets like my old Phanteks case but I tried to keep my cables tidy.
customer_reviews.author: Mohawkchris

customer_reviews.title: OK, But Watch Out for Glass Panel
customer_reviews.text: No complaints really but be very careful with the glass panel. Mine fell over on the kitchen floor and shattered into a hundred pieces. Of course, it is my fault for not being more careful. Fortunately, the solution is an 18 x 18 replacement piece of plexiglass I am mounting on the side, so I'm only out $17.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Great case no problems here
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure this is the best tempered glass case for this price point. The tempered glass has an awesome dark tint to it, great if you want to do a more subtle build. The case modularity is also pretty great. Also if you want to PC that you can mod this is the case to go for at this price point
customer_reviews.author: nicholas p.

customer_reviews.title: Great looking mid tower case with decent airflow for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Great looking mid tower case with decent airflow for a good price. I was afraid of front panel and associated airflow issues but actual measurements show negligible difference caused by it. I have Corsair H100i v2 installed immediately after two bottom front fans in push-pull configuration. In such setup temperature of my i7 8700k is 27 C idle and ~58 C in games. MSI GTX 1080 ARMOR 8G OC temperature under full load never went above 70 C. If you want RGB illumination be sure that your motherboard has RGB pins.
customer_reviews.author: Anton Kutepov

customer_reviews.title: No place for DVD/CD player
customer_reviews.text: I guess it is mostly my fault I looked at the picture. Now I have to purchase an external DVD/CD player. I consider it a weakness in the design since the OS and Windows came on DVD discs. Otherwise I found the case very easy to use. I have not powered my build on yet so more comments may follow.
customer_reviews.author: David Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good Case
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice case to build a normal use pc. Not for gamers due to lack of air flow. Cable management is great and a lot of space for ssd. I like it but I would not buy it due to air flow limitation.
customer_reviews.author: Franty

product_meta.title: Cooler Master MasterBox Pro 5 RGB ATX Mid-Tower with Three 120mm RGB Fans, Front DarkMirror Panel, Tempered Glass, RGB Splitter Cable & RGB Lighting System
product_meta.description: Style:MB Pro 5 RGB| Size:ATX Mid-TowerThe Master Box Pro 5 RGB's straightforward design comes with three 120mm RGB fans installed behind the dark mirror front panel and a 4mm thick edge to edge tempered glass side panel which give the case a unique outlook and various options to show off your build inside. The interior offers conveniently placed cut outs, making component installation, interior expansion, and multiple interior layouts simple and easy. It can also support large, high end components, several fans and DIY liquid cooling. Keep your system looking clean with numerous routing holes and a cover for your PSU.
feature_bullets: Flexible mounting:  easily mount and rearrange SSDs across the motherboard tray and on the back with the SSD bracket
1 to 3 splitter cable for RGB LED fans: the RGB connector splitter and 4 pin Male to Male adapters are included

4 millimeter thick edge to edge tempered glass Side panel: once you finished your build it's time to show off your creation in style through the 4 millimeter thick edge to edge tempered glass Side panel
Rib fans 3 120 millimeter RGB: fans are pre-installed behind the front panel to create an amazing lighting effect
Compact cooling: with the included bracket, the case supports up to 3 120 millimeter front fans, 1 120 millimeter rear fan, and up to 360 millimeter front radiator for liquid cooling

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,226 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
